str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To enlarge, make broad; met: of the growth of tenderness and love. From platus; to widen.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Neuter of a derivative of phulasso; a guard-case, i.e. 'phylactery' for wearing slips of Scripture texts.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I enlarge, lengthen, (b) I increase, magnify, extol. From megas; to make great, i.e. Increase or extol.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The fringe, edge, corner, tassel. Of uncertain derivation; a margin, i.e., a fringe or tassel.
